availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Daniel (Booneville attorney and infantry first lieutenant)

body.p: Booneville, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Served in the U.S.-Mexican War. Attorney in Booneville in 1860. Second and First Lieutenant in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.).

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, p. 305. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Boonville, p. 44. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Boonville, p. 3. National Park Service, Soldiers and Sailors Database, "Gep W. Daniel," https://www.nps.gov/civilwar/search-soldiers-detail.htm?soldierId=1102C593-DC7A-DF11-BF36-B8AC6F5D926A. Organization Index to Pension Files of Veterans who served between 1861 and 1900, Civil War Pensions Index, roll no. 159. KYR-0001-004-1337.
